website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight neutral shoe perfect for speedwork or racing.
pros: Features an attractive price tag and a design that feels fast
Flexible upper provides an excellent fit that's great for odd foot shapes or those with foot ailments such as bunions
cons: Poor choice for tall or heavy runners who need more cushioning for impact protection

customer_reviews.title: Too Firm for Running, but an OK Casual Shoe.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are comfortable, fit just a little on the smaller size, and have a firm sole. They are good for casual weekend wear or for weights/cross training at the gym. However, I bought them for running (recommended by a popular running website) and they are too firm for me. I typically run about 25 miles/week on pavement and these don't provide enough cushion. After a few runs, I felt it in my shins/joints and returned to my Nike Frees. Keeping them for casual wear, but no more running in them.
customer_reviews.author: Evil Attorney

customer_reviews.title: Great while they lasted but not great durability
customer_reviews.text: Great while it lasted but was disappointed with the durability of the sole. The V3's lasted 300+ miles for me, but the V4's lost the tread at 200 miles. They were softer feeling in the midsole and maybe that's where the quicker wear occurred. Not sure, but I'll need to find something else for a speed shoe going forward.
customer_reviews.author: WilliW

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for runners of all levels
customer_reviews.text: Im a big fan of the Zante line. Comfortable, some cushion but not too much, and firm but not too firm. In contrast to high cusion, highly supportive shoes, the Zantes make your feet do a little more of the work, which is a good thing. They excel at fast running but Ive used it for slow long runs as well. Also important to note, the v4 feels very mich like the v3. They didnt change much.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hanna

customer_reviews.title: not as good as fresh foam Zante v2
customer_reviews.text: I am a long time NB wearer and many different styles have fit me well. the fresh foam Zante v2 is my favorite "fast" shoe. This version is a step back from that. It is adequate for running and reasonably comfortable but it feels heavier and less cushioned than v2. also it is the first NB shoe I have bought in a while that did not fit as advertised. I am 11.5 D (medium). This shoe is at least a quarter size smaller. If I wear the thinnest pair of socks I own, it fits ok, but I prefer to wear thicker socks when running. NB: please bring back the Zante v2.
customer_reviews.author: Tim D.

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable and light weight shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought both colors, very comfortable and light weight shoes. Fits perfect because I know my size which is 15 2E. They are listed as weighing 8.6 oz for normal feet. These shoes weigh 13.25 oz each which is 5 oz lighter than my other walking/running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Rvdan

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes, good price, similar to older models
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of Zantes, and I will continue to buy them if they keep the $60ish price point. While I do not think they are my favorite shoes, they are just a good solid fairly minimal shoes for some good 5-10 mile runs. I do not think I'd use these in a 10+ mile run, but I would consider them for a 5k-10k race since they are pretty lightweight and flat. Just good pair of trainers for a good price and if they are like the last couple pairs I hope to get 300-400 miles out of them.
customer_reviews.author: perrbr

customer_reviews.title: Nowhere near as good as previous Zantes
customer_reviews.text: Finally wore out my original pair if Zante v1 and picked these up expecting the same comfort/quality and have been disappointed. The fit isn't right (I wear 13EE) and they don't ride nearly as comfortably when jogging. These are a big downgrade from previous generations.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Favorite shoe
customer_reviews.text: You might only get 300 miles out of them. They are light. The midsole has a great blend of cushioning and responsiveness. Haven't ran beyond 13 miles on a run, but I feel that they would be comfortable beyond that.
customer_reviews.author: Koi

customer_reviews.title: Best budget running shoe for me
customer_reviews.text: Initial foam felt stiff but as the first ran began it had a lot of spring in it. The mesh over the top was more breathable than I originally expected. The only complain that I had was while walking or standing the shoes felt tight, while running I didn’t feel any of that.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel M LoRusso

customer_reviews.title: Solid shoe, small issues.
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe. True to size. Two wishes: 1). Wish it had more support in the sole, especially the heel. 2). Wish the toe box material was less pourous. Very easy to be running with wet feet after one misstep into a puddle.
customer_reviews.author: CrazyGirl79

customer_reviews.title: Best running sneakers I ever had
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I ran over 200 miles in these shoes and it’s still in good condition! I’ll just say they do run narrow so I order a wide and it fit perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Angel Mercado

customer_reviews.title: VERY comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I need more support for jogging and wear NB 1080 12 1/2 4E. These however are perfect for wearing around the tile floor house in 12W, without socks but with a Sof Sole insert.
customer_reviews.author: Beth A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Cushioned neutral lightweight, great, don’t hesitate
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Very comfortable and light weight. Have only run on the treadmill so far because the weather has been so nasty but they feel great.
customer_reviews.author: John Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Fit is more narrow than my other New Balance shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've been running in New Balance shoes for the past few years and I bought this pair on Amazon without trying them on. They are more narrow than the other pairs I've had and cause a little pain on the top of the foot from being too narrow. Very nice looking shoe and I still use for walking around very loosely laced, but not for fitness.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Timely delivery
customer_reviews.text: The shoe was delivered ahead of promised time but am yet to run with it. Will probably update after my first 35km in it.
customer_reviews.author: Omobolaji Badmus

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, high quality
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes - this is my second pair after wearing out the first over time. Use for workout classes and running, and first pair lasted a year of daily use before the traction started to fade on the soles.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C

customer_reviews.title: Very light
customer_reviews.text: Only down side is the “fresh foam” has little holes in it
customer_reviews.author: kk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My teenage son loves this shoe for his long distance running.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: GORG
customer_reviews.text: It would be 5 star if I didn't feel like top of heel still needs stretching - the look & super lightweight comfort of these fresh foams is hard to beat - New Balance PLEASE keep making these in size 16
customer_reviews.author: Artist / Chef

customer_reviews.title: You'll look sharp in these good buddy.
customer_reviews.text: I used these at the gymnasium and boy were they the stuff!
customer_reviews.author: ch

customer_reviews.title: Light on budget and weight
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy and a great light shoe. Surprised with the quality given the entry level price.
customer_reviews.author: NDR

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I feel good .. heavy .. i can used for gym and runing
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love These Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes, a little narrow but all I had to do was loosen the laces a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Dewey

customer_reviews.title: The most important thing is the the way it is designed for walking and it's very very easy on the feet
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe and it's and it's very cool in the summer and great the walk-in doesn't hurt to back like other ones do great shoe
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes, but they run a little small
customer_reviews.text: They're very comfortable and I like the way they look. Mine seem a little small, so consider
customer_reviews.author: Austin Vickers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wore the v3 and was excited to get the v4. So far I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.Y.

customer_reviews.title: Comfy light good grip and flexibility
customer_reviews.text: My son loves them. Comfy light good grip and flexibility
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I ordered these z4's in the same size as my ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these z4's in the same size as my z3's and the z4's are smaller. Going to try a size up.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Curley

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's Zante V4 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: The sleekest ride of Fresh Foam continues to deliver smooth for the speedy. Engineered and designed for those seeking a swifter pace, a fresh foam midsole delivers soft cushioning with every step. A bootie construction and HypoSkin upper create a snug midfoot fit while an engineered mesh vamp lets the toes play for efficiency.
